intro: Dischisma squarrosum, commonly known as the silky dischisma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly called the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid gardens.
